thread.title: Here’s how Apple, Nike and others avoided $620 billion in taxes - MarketWatch
thread.title_full: Here’s how Apple, Nike and others avoided $620 billion in taxes - MarketWatch

author: MarketWatch
title: Here’s how Apple, Nike and others avoided $620 billion in taxes - MarketWatch
text:
MARKETWATCH FRONT PAGE Big U.S. companies are holding more than $2.1 trillion in profits overseas and are avoiding paying about $620 billion in U.S. taxes, according to a study released Tuesday. See full story.
Personal property portfolios of Donald Trump, Elon Musk and 6 other billionaires Eight men, 38 properties, some 300,000 square feet of ludicrous wealth and more bathrooms than anybody could possibly put to use in a lifetime of relaxing on gold-plated bidets. See full story.
What I learned traveling with Europe’s new migrants Ultimately, I am not certain whether my understanding of Europe’s migration crisis was made larger or smaller by my journey with people from Syria, Iraq, Afghanistan and other countries. But I certainly learned a lot about what the young men, women and children were enduring as they sought less hazardous, politically and economically, lives than those available in their countries of origin. See full story.
Known Tesla bulls sound the alarm about Model X price Shares fall nearly 4% as analysts at Morgan Stanley cut their price target on the stock. See full story.
Rumored merger of Lions Gate, Starz could create media powerhouse Film and TV studio Lions Gate is among the top 10 highest grossing studios at the box office this year. One analyst says a combination with Starz would be even more powerful. See full story.
MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE China, where driving a Buick and drinking a PBR are signs you’ve made it. See full story.
More from MarketWatch
